abstract: Judge Wolfgang Rosenbusch in Hanover, Germany, gives stiff prison sentences to three people involved in August 2015 arson attack on home for refugees in town of Salzhemmendorf; says neo-Nazi beliefs motivated trio's racial hatred.
lead_paragraph: The judge in the case attributed the actions of the defendants to their radical right-wing, neo-Nazi beliefs.

headline.main: 3 Sentenced in Germany for Arson Attack Against Refugees
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Germany: 3 Sentenced in Arson Attack on Refugees

snippet: The judge in the case attributed the actions of the defendants to their radical right-wing, neo-Nazi beliefs.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
